analyzed: yena u ca anyāni havīṃṣi ekam vai eṣa bhāgam  krīyamāṇaḥ bhikrīyate candasām eva rājyāya candasām sāmrājyāya tasya
translated: For he is taken as one part🔽being taken for the kingship of the metres, for the sovereignty of the metres.

original: candāṃsyabhitaḥ sācayāni yathā rājño 'rājāno rājakṛtaḥ sūtagrāmaṇya evamasya
analyzed: candāṃsi abhitas sācayāni yathā rājñaḥ rājānaḥ rājakṛtaḥ sūta grāmaṇyaḥ evam asya
translated: The metres are to be combined around it, just as the non-kings, the king-makers, the charioteers and village-chiefs are around a king.

analyzed: candāṃsi abhitas sācayāni
translated: Thus the metres are to be combined around it.

analyzed: na vai tat avakalpate
translated: But that is not proper,

original: yaccandobhya iti kevalaṃ gṛhṇīyādyatra vā arhate pacanti
analyzed: yat candobhyaḥ iti kevalam gṛhṇīyāt yatra vai arhate pacanti
translated: that he should take it only with a metre, with which he would take it from the metres. For wherever they cook for a worthy man,

analyzed: tat abhitas sācayaḥ nu ābhaktāḥ bhavanti a rājānaḥ rāja kṛtaḥ
translated: the others are combined around it, the non-kings, the king-makers,

analyzed: sūta grāmaṇyaḥ tasmāt yatra eva etasyai gṛhṇīyāt tat eva candāṃsi anvābhajet
translated: the charioteers and village-chiefs. Therefore wherever he would take it for this (cow), there he should distribute the metres around it.

original: sa gṛhṇāti / agnestanūrasi viṣṇave tvetyagnirvai gāyatrī tadgāyatrīmanvābhajati / / /
analyzed: sa gṛhṇāti agneḥ tanūḥ asi viṣṇave tvā iti agniḥ vai gāyatrī tat gāyatrīm anvābhajati
translated: He takes it with, 'Thou art the body of Agni: for Vishnu thee!' Agni is the Gâyatrî; he thus allots the Gâyatrî to him.

analyzed: somasya tanūḥ asi viṣṇave tvā iti
translated: 'Thou art the body of Soma: for Vishnu thee!'

analyzed: kṣatram vai somaḥ kṣatram
translated: Soma is the Kshatra (nobility, power);

analyzed: triṣṭubh tat triṣṭubham anvābhajati

analyzed: atitheḥ ātithyam asi viṣṇave tvā iti
translated: 'Thou art the guest-hospitality: for Vishnu thee!'

analyzed: saḥ u sya uddhāraḥ yathā śreṣṭhasya uddhāraḥ evam asya eṣa
translated: This is his share; as the share of the chief (is the best), so is this his.

analyzed: ṛte candobhyaḥ

original: śyenāya tvā somabhṛte viṣṇave tveti /🔽tadgāyatrīmanvābhajati sā yadgāyatrī śyeno🔽bhūtvā divaḥ somamāharattena sā śyenaḥ somabhṛttenaivaināmetadvīryeṇa
analyzed: śyenāya tvā soma bhṛte viṣṇave tvā iti  tat gāyatrīm anvābhajati sā yat gāyatrī śyenaḥ  bhūtvā divaḥ somam āharat tena sā śyenaḥ soma bhṛt tena eva enām etat vīryeṇa

analyzed: dvitīyam anvābhajati

analyzed: agnaye tvā rāyaspoṣa de viṣṇave tvā iti
translated: 'For Agni, the increaser of wealth, for Vishnu thee!'

analyzed: paśavaḥ vai rāyaspoṣaḥ paśavaḥ jagatī
translated: Wealth-increasing (means) cattle; the Gagatî is cattle;

analyzed: tat jagatīm anvābhajati  atha yat pañca kṛtvas gṛhṇāti
translated: he thus allots the Gagatî to him.

original: saṃvatsarasammito vai yajñaḥ pañca vā ṛtavaḥ
analyzed: saṃvatsara sammitaḥ vai yajñaḥ pañca vai ṛtavaḥ
translated: And as to why he takes (Soma) five times,--the sacrifice is commensurate with the year, and there are five seasons.

original: saṃvatsarasya tam pañcabhirāpnoti tasmātpañca kṛtvo gṛhṇātyatha yadviṣṇave tvā
analyzed: saṃvatsarasya tam pañcabhiḥ āpnoti tasmāt pañca kṛtvas gṛhṇāti atha yat viṣṇave tvā

translated: He obtains it with five (verses) of the year; therefore he takes it five times. And as to why he takes it with 'To Vishnu thee! To Vishnu thee!' he takes it to Vishnu, for he who takes it for the sacrifice takes it to Vishnu.

analyzed: nava kapālaḥ puroḍāśaḥ bhavati
translated: The sacrificial cake is on nine potsherds.

original: śiro vai yajñasyātithyaṃ navākṣarā vai gāyatryaṣṭau🔽tāni yānyanvāha praṇavo navamaḥ pūrvārdho vai yajñasya gāyatrī pūrvārdhe eṣa
analyzed: śiraḥ vai yajñasya ātithyam nava akṣarā vai gāyatrī aṣṭau  tāni yāni anvāha praṇavaḥ navamaḥ pūrva ardhaḥ vai yajñasya gāyatrī pūrva ardhe eṣa

analyzed: yajñasya tasmāt nava kapālaḥ puroḍāśaḥ bhavati
translated: and the Praṇava is the ninth. The Gayatri is the fore-part of the sacrifice; in the fore-part of the sacrifice he thus puts the head of the sacrifice. Therefore the sacrificial cake is on nine potsherds.

analyzed: kārṣmarya mayāḥ paridhayaḥ

analyzed: devāḥ ha vai etam vanaspatiṣu rākṣoghnam  dadṛśuḥ yat kārṣmaryam śiraḥ vai yajñasya ātithyam necire yajñasya nāṣṭrāḥ rakṣāṃsi
translated: The gods saw that Kârshmarya wood among the trees as the slayer of Rakshas;

analyzed: hinasan iti tasmāt kārṣmarya mayāḥ paridhayaḥ bhavanti
translated: and the guest-offering is the head of the sacrifice: 'Lest the Rakshas, the fiends, should injure the head of the sacrifice,' thus they thought, and therefore the enclosing-sticks are of Kârshmarya wood.

analyzed: āśvavālaḥ prastaraḥ
translated: The Prastara is of Asvavâla grass.

original: yajño ha devebhyo 'pacakrāma so 'śvo bhūtvā parāṅāvavarta

translated: The sacrifice went away from the gods: it became a horse and went away from them.

analyzed: tasya devāḥ anuhāya vālān abhipeduḥ tān ālulupuḥ tān ālupya sārdham saṃnyāsuḥ tatas etā

analyzed: aikṣavyau vidhṛtī

analyzed: janayati agniḥ vai sarvāḥ devatāḥ agnau hi sarvābhyaḥ devatābhyaḥ juhvati śiraḥ vai

analyzed: tasmāt agnim manthati
translated: Therefore he churns the fire.🔽.🔽

translated: for these two are indeed the two testicles of the woman.

translated: He puts it down, saying, 'Thou art Purûravâ.' Urvasi was the Apsaras, and Purûravâ was her husband.🔽And what was born from that pair was life. In like manner does he now beget the sacrifice from that pair.

analyzed: janayati atha āha agnaye mathyamānāya anubrūhi iti
translated: He then says, 'Recite to Agni who is being churned!'

analyzed: sa manthati
translated: He churns (the fire).

analyzed: gāyatreṇa tvā candasā manthāmi traiṣṭubhena tvā candasā manthāmi

translated: he recites to Agni who is being churned; the metres alone he thereby causes to follow the sacrifice, as the rays (follow) the sun.

translated: 'Recite for the born one!' he says when it is born. 'To the one being carried forward,' he says when carrying it forward.

analyzed: saḥ nupraharati  bhavatam naḥ samanasau sacetasau arepasau mā yajñam hiṃsiṣṭam

analyzed: mā yajñapatim jātavedasau śivau bhavatam adya naḥ iti śāntim eva ābhyām etat vadati

translated: so that they may not injure each other.🔽Then, having taken up the ghee with the dipping-spoon,

translated: he offers it on the fire: 'In the fire moves the fire, the son of the Rishis,

analyzed: abhiśasti pāvā sa naḥ syonaḥ suyajā yaja iha devebhyaḥ havyam

analyzed: sadam aprayucan svāhā iti āhutyai vai etam ajījanata
translated: the ever-active one, svâhâ!' For him they have generated this oblation;

analyzed: tam etayā āhutyā apraiṣīt tasmāt evam abhijuhoti
translated: with this oblation he has sent him forth. Therefore he offers in this way.

analyzed: tad iḍā antam bhavati
translated: It ends with the Ida.

original: nānuyājānyajanti śiro vai yajñasyātithyam pūrvārdho vai śiraḥ
analyzed: na anuyājān yajanti śiraḥ vai yajñasya ātithyam pūrva ardhaḥ vai śiraḥ

translated: he thus makes the fore-part of the sacrifice complete. If he were to offer the after-sacrifices, it would be as if he were to cut off🔽the head from the fore-part.

analyzed: paryāhṛtya pādau pratidadhyāt evam tat tasmāt iḍā antam bhavati na anuyājān yajanti

analyzed: ātithyena vai devāḥ iṣṭvā
translated: The gods, having performed the guest-offering,

translated: found them. They ran away in four directions, each one with the glory of the others.

analyzed: a tiṣṭhamānāḥ agniḥ vasubhiḥ somaḥ rudraiḥ varuṇaḥ ādityaiḥ indraḥ
translated: Standing apart, Agni with the Vasus, Soma with the Rudras, Varuna with the Adityas, Indra

original: marudbhirbṛhaspatirviśvairdevairityu haika āhurete ha tveva te viśve devā ye te
analyzed: marudbhiḥ bṛhaspatiḥ viśvaiḥ devaiḥ iti u ha eke āhuḥ ete ha tu eva te viśve devāḥ ye te
translated: with the Maruts, Brihaspati with the Visve Devas. Some say this, but they are indeed those Visve Devas who

translated: ran away in four directions. The Asuras and Rakshasas followed them as they fled.

original: te 'viduḥ / pāpīyāṃso vai bhavāmo 'surarakṣasāni vai no 'nuvyavāgurdviṣadbhyo vai🔽radhyāmo hanta saṃjānāmahā ekasya śriyai tiṣṭhāmahā iti ta indrasya śriyā
analyzed: te viduḥ pāpīyāṃsaḥ vai bhavāmaḥ surarakṣasāni vai naḥ nuvyavāguḥ dviṣadbhyaḥ vai  radhyāmaḥ hanta saṃjānāmahai ekasya śriyai tiṣṭhāmahai iti te indrasya śriyā
translated: They knew: 'We have become worse. The Asuras and Rakshasas have followed us. We shall be given to our enemies.

original: atiṣṭhanta tasmādāhurindraḥ sarvā devatā indraśreṣṭhā devā iti / / /
analyzed: atiṣṭhanta tasmāt āhuḥ indraḥ sarvāḥ devatāḥ indra śreṣṭhāḥ devāḥ iti
translated: Let us agree together. Let us stand in the glory of one.' They stood in the glory of Indra. Therefore they say: 'Indra is all the deities. The gods have Indra as their best.'

analyzed: tasmāt u ha na svāḥ ṛtīyeran
translated: Therefore, indeed, they should not transgress (his will).

original: ya eṣām parastarāmiva bhavati sa enānanuvyavaiti te
analyzed: yaḥ eṣām parastarām iva bhavati saḥ enān anuvyavaiti te
translated: He who is the most distant of them, he follows them.

original: priyaṃ dviṣatāṃ kurvanti dviṣadbhyo radhyanti tasmānna 'rtīyerantsa yo haivaṃ
analyzed: priyam dviṣatām kurvanti dviṣadbhyaḥ radhyanti tasmāt na rtīyeran sa yaḥ ha evam
translated: They do what is dear to their enemies, and are hated by their enemies. Therefore they should not be despised. He who thus

analyzed: vidvān na rtīyate priyam dviṣatām karoti na dvipadbhyaḥ radhyati tasmāt na rtīyeta
translated: They do what is agreeable to their enemies, and are ruined by their enemies. Therefore they should not be despised. He who, knowing thus, is not despised, does what is disagreeable to his enemies, and is not ruined by men. Therefore he should not be despised.

original: te hocuḥ / hantedaṃ tathā karavāmahai yathā na idamāpradivamevājaryamasaditi / / /🔽te devāḥ / juṣṭāstanūḥ priyāṇi dhāmāni sārdhaṃ samavadadire te hocuretena naḥ sa🔽nānāsadetena viṣvaṅyo na etadatikrāmāditi kasyopadraṣṭuriti tanūnaptureva
analyzed: te ha ūcuḥ hanta idam tathā karavāmahai yathā naḥ idam āpradivam eva ajaryam asat iti  te devāḥ juṣṭāḥ tanūḥ priyāṇi dhāmāni sārdham samavadadire te ha ūcuḥ etena naḥ sa  nānā asat etena viṣvaṅyaḥ naḥ etat atikrāmāt iti kasya upadraṣṭuḥ iti tanū naptuḥ eva
translated: They said: 'Come, let us so arrange this that it may not be destroyed by fire.'

original: śākvarasyeti yo vā ayam eṣa tanūnapācākvaraḥ so 'yam prajānāmupadraṣṭā
analyzed: śākvarasya iti yaḥ vai ayam eṣa tanūnapāt cākvaraḥ saḥ yam prajānām upadraṣṭā
translated: Those gods, their pleasing forms and dear abodes, agreed together. They said: 'By this we shall become different from each other. For this Tanūnapāt, the son of Śakra, has entered as the overseer of creatures.

analyzed: praviṣṭaḥ tau imau prāṇa udānau
translated: These two, the out-breath and the in-breath.

analyzed: tasmāt āhuḥ
translated: Therefore they say:

analyzed: manaḥ devāḥ manuṣyasya ajānanti iti manasā saṃkalpayati
translated: 'The gods know the mind of man.' He resolves with the mind.

original: tatprāṇamapipadyate prāṇo vātaṃ vāto devebhya ācaṣṭe yathā puruṣasya manaḥ / / /
analyzed: tat prāṇam apipadyate prāṇaḥ vātam vātaḥ devebhyaḥ ācaṣṭe yathā puruṣasya manaḥ
translated: That enters the breath. The breath tells the wind, and the wind tells the gods, as a man's mind.

analyzed: tasmāt etat ṛṣiṇā abhyanūktam
translated: Therefore this has been said by the seer:

analyzed: manasā saṃkalpayati tat vātam apigacati vātaḥ devebhyaḥ
translated: He conceives in his mind, and that becomes wind. Wind goes to the gods.

original: ācaṣṭe yathā puruṣa te mana iti / / /🔽te devāḥ / juṣṭāstanūḥ priyāṇi dhāmāni sārdhaṃ samavadadire te hocuretena naḥ sa🔽nānāsadetena viṣvaṅyo na etadatikrāmāditi taddevā apyetarhi nātikrāmanti ke hi

analyzed: atha purastāt  udīcīm śamyām nidadhāti sa parilikhati vittāyanī me

analyzed: atha vapām utkhidanti  tayā vapāśrapaṇyau prorṇauti ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī
translated: Then they take out the omentum.

original: prorṇuvāthāmiti tadime dyāvāpṛthivī ūrjā rasena bhājayatyanayorūrjaṃ rasaṃ dadhāti
analyzed: prorṇuvāthām iti tat ime dyāvāpṛthivī ūrjā rasena bhājayati anayoḥ ūrjam rasam dadhāti
translated: With it he covers the two omentum-forks, with 'With ghee, O ye heaven and earth, cover yourselves', he says; verily he makes these two, heaven and earth, to be full of sap and strength, he bestows upon them sap and strength.

original: te rasavatyā upajīvanīye imāḥ prajā upajīvanti / / /
analyzed: te rasavatyāḥ upajīvanīye imāḥ prajāḥ upajīvanti
translated: On these two full of sap and strength these creatures live.

analyzed: kārṣmarya mayyau vapāśrapaṇyau bhavataḥ
translated: The two omentum-forks are of Kârshmarya wood.

original: yatra vai devā agre paśumālebhire🔽tadudīcaḥ kṛṣyamāṇasyāvāṇnedhaḥ papāta sa eṣa vanaspatirajāyata
analyzed: yatra vai devāḥ agre paśum ālebhire  tat udīcaḥ kṛṣyamāṇasya avāṅ nedhaḥ papāta saḥ eṣa vanaspatiḥ ajāyata
translated: Where the gods first seized the victim,🔽the omentum fell down towards the north, being drawn out; it became this tree.

analyzed: tat yat kṛṣyamāṇasya avāṅapatat tasmāt kārṣmaryaḥ tena eva enam etat medhena
translated: Inasmuch as it fell down towards the north, being drawn out, therefore it is the Kârshmarya. With that same sacrificial essence he thus appeases it.

original: samardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti tasmātkārṣmaryamayyau vapāśrapaṇyau bhavataḥ / / /
analyzed: samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti tasmāt kārṣmarya mayyau vapāśrapaṇyau bhavataḥ
translated: He makes it prosper, he makes it complete: therefore the omentum-forks are of Kârshmarya wood.

analyzed: tām parivāsayati
translated: He then bastes it (with water).

original: tām paśuśrapaṇe pratapati tatho hāsyātrāpi śṛtā bhavati
analyzed: tām paśuśrapaṇe pratapati tathā u ha asya atra api śṛtā bhavati
translated: He heats it on the animal's spit; and thus it becomes cooked for him even here.

original: punarulmukamagnīdādatte te jaghanena cātvālaṃ yanti ta āyantyāgacantyāhavanīyaṃ
analyzed: punar ulmukam agnīdh ādatte te jaghanena cātvālam yanti te āyanti āgacanti āhavanīyam
translated: The Agnîdh then takes up the fire-brand again, and they proceed to the south of the pit, and come up to the Âhavanîya.

original: sa etattṛṇamadhvaryurāhavanīye prāsyati vāyo vai stokānāmiti stokānāṃ haiṣā samit / / /
analyzed: saḥ etat tṛṇam adhvaryuḥ āhavanīye prāsyati vāyo vai stokānām iti stokānām ha eṣā samidh
translated: The Adhvaryu throws that straw on the Âhavanîya, with , 'O Vâyu, of the drops,'--for this is the kindling-stick of the drops.

analyzed: atha uttaratas tiṣṭhan vapām pratapati
translated: He then bastes the omentum, standing to the north (of the fire).

analyzed: atyeṣyan vai eṣaḥ gnim bhavati dakṣiṇatas
translated: He (the animal) is about to pass by the fire, on the south side,

original: parītya śrapayiṣyaṃstasmā evaitannihnute tatho hainameṣo 'tiyantamagnirna hinasti
analyzed: parītya śrapayiṣyan tasmai eva etat nihnute tathā u ha enam eṣa u tiyantam agniḥ na hinasti
translated: after going round it, in order to cook it: he thereby appeases it, and so that fire does not injure him as he passes by it.

analyzed: tasmāt uttaratas tiṣṭhan vapām pratapati
translated: For this reason he bastes the omentum, standing to the north (of the fire).

original: tāmantareṇa yūpaṃ cāgniṃ ca haranti /🔽tadyatsamayā na haranti yenānyāni havīṃṣi
analyzed: tām antareṇa yūpam ca agnim ca haranti  tat yat samayā na haranti yena anyāni havīṃṣi
translated: They carry it (to the slaughtering-place) between the sacrificial stake and the fire.

original: haranti nedaśṛtayā samayā yajñam prasajāmeti yadu bāhyena na harantyagreṇa yūpam
analyzed: haranti na id a śṛtayā samayā yajñam prasajāma iti yat u bāhyena na haranti agreṇa yūpam
translated: The reason why they do not carry it along the range (of the fires) by which they carry the other sacrificial dishes, is lest they should approach the sacrifice with (the omentum) uncooked. And why they do not carry it by the outside, in front of the sacrificial stake,

original: bahirdhā yajñātkuryustasmādantareṇa yūpaṃ cāgniṃ ca haranti dakṣiṇataḥ parītya
analyzed: bahirdhā yajñāt kuryuḥ tasmāt antareṇa yūpam ca agnim ca haranti dakṣiṇatas parītya
translated: They should do it outside the sacrifice; therefore they carry it along between the sacrificial post and the fire, having gone round on the south side.

analyzed: pratiprasthātā śrapayati
translated: The Pratiprasthātṛ cooks it.

analyzed: atha sruveṇa upahatya ājyam  adhvaryuḥ vapām abhijuhoti agniḥ ājyasya vetu svāhā iti tathā
translated: Then, having taken up the ghee with the dipping-spoon,🔽the Adhvaryu offers the omentum on it with the formula, May Agni accept the ghee, svāhā. In this way

original: hāsyaite stokāḥ śṛtāḥ svāhākṛtā āhutayo bhūtvāgnim prāpnuvanti / / /
analyzed: ha asya ete stokāḥ śṛtāḥ svāhākṛtāḥ āhutayaḥ bhūtvā agnim prāpnuvanti
translated: these drops of his become offered oblations with the word svāhā and reach Agni.

original: athāha stokebhyo 'nubrūhīti /🔽sa āgneyī stokebhyo 'nvāha tadyadāgneyī stokebhyo🔽'nvāhetaḥpradānā vai vṛṣṭirito hyagnirvṛṣṭiṃ vanute sa etai stokairetāntstokānvanute
analyzed: atha āha stokebhyaḥ nubrūhi iti  saḥ āgneyīḥ stokebhyaḥ nu āha tat yat āgneyīḥ stokebhyaḥ  nvāha itas pradānā vai vṛṣṭiḥ itas hi agniḥ vṛṣṭim vanute saḥ etaiḥ stokaiḥ etān stokān vanute
translated: Then he says (to the Hotṛ), Do you recite the puronuvākyā for the drops.🔽He recites to the drops the verse addressed to Agni. The reason why he recites to the drops the verse addressed to Agni is that rain is bestowed from here, for from here Agni impels rain. He follows those drops with these drops.

original: ta ete stokā varṣanti tasmādāgneyī stokebhyo 'nvāha yadā śṛtā bhavati / / /
analyzed: te ete stokāḥ varṣanti tasmāt āgneyī stokebhyaḥ nu āha yadā śṛtā bhavati
translated: Those drops rain down. Therefore he recites to the drops the verse addressed to Agni. When it is cooked.

original: athāha pratiprasthātā śṛtā pracareti /🔽srucāvādāyādhvaryuratikramyāśrāvyāha🔽svāhākṛtibhyaḥ preṣyeti vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti / / /
analyzed: atha āha pratiprasthātā śṛtā pracara iti  srucau ādāya adhvaryuḥ atikramya āśrāvya āha  svāhākṛtibhyaḥ preṣya iti vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti
translated: Then he says (to the Hotṛ), Do you recite the yājyā for the cooked (food).🔽Having taken up the two spoons, the Adhvaryu, having stepped up (to the fire), having caused to announce,🔽says (to the Hotṛ), Do you call out (the Hotṛ to recite the yājyā) for the Svāhā-utterance, and makes the offering at the Vaṣat-utterance.

analyzed: hutvā vapām eva agre bhighārayati
translated: Having made the offering, he first bastes the omentum.

analyzed: atha pṛṣadājyam tat u ha caraka adhvaryavaḥ
translated: Then the speckled ghee. Now, the Cārakādhvaryus

analyzed: pṛṣadājyam eva agre bhighārayanti prāṇaḥ pṛṣadājyam iti vadantaḥ tat u ha
translated: They besprinkle the speckled butter first. They say, 'The speckled butter is the breath.' But

analyzed: yājñavalkyam caraka adhvaryuḥ anuvyājahāra evam kurvantam prāṇam vā
translated: the Adhvaryu Charaka,

analyzed: ayam antaragāt adhvaryuḥ prāṇaḥ enam hāsyati iti
translated: while doing this, spoke to Yajnavalkya: 'The Adhvaryu has entered into the breath; the breath will abandon him.'

original: sa ha sma bāhū anvavekṣyāha /🔽imau palitau bāhū kva svidbrāhmaṇasya vaco
analyzed: sa ha sma bāhū anvavekṣya āha  imau palitau bāhū kva svid brāhmaṇasya vacaḥ
translated: He then looked at his arms and said:

original: babhūveti na tadādriyetottamo vā eṣa prayājo bhavatīdaṃ vai haviryajña uttame🔽prayāje dhruvāmevāgre 'bhighārayati tasyai hi prathamāvājyabhāgau hoṣyanbhavati
analyzed: babhūva iti na tat ādriyeta uttamaḥ vai eṣa prayājaḥ bhavati idam vai haviḥ yajñaḥ uttame  prayāje dhruvām eva agre bhighārayati tasyai hi prathamau ājyabhāgau hoṣyan bhavati
translated: 'Where has the Brahman's speech gone to these two gray arms?' One should not pay attention to that. This is the highest fore-offering. The oblation is the highest🔽in the fore-offering. He first besprinkles the firm one, for he is about to offer the two first portions of ghee to it.

original: vapāṃ vā atra prathamāṃ hoṣyanbhavati tasmādvapāmevāgre 'bhighārayedatha
analyzed: vapām vai atra prathamām hoṣyan bhavati tasmāt vapām eva agre bhighārayet atha
translated: Or he is about to offer the first portion of the omentum. Therefore he should first besprinkle the omentum.

analyzed: pṛṣadājyam atha yat paśum na abhighārayati na id a śṛtam abhighārayāṇi iti etat eva asya sarvaḥ  paśuḥ abhighā
translated: Then the speckled butter. Then why he does not besprinkle the animal - lest he should besprinkle what is not cooked. This entire

analyzed: ritaḥ bhavati yat vapām abhighārayati tasmāt vapām eva agre bhighārayet atha  pṛṣadājyam
translated: animal is besprinkled for him by the besprinkling of the omentum. Therefore he should first besprinkle the omentum.

analyzed: atha ājyam upastṛṇīte
translated: Then the speckled butter.🔽Then he spreads the ghee.

analyzed: atha hiraṇya śakalam avadadhāti atha  vapām avadyan āha agnīṣomābhyām ca āgasya vapāyai medasaḥ nubrūhi iti atha
translated: He then puts down a piece of gold.🔽While cutting up the omentum, he says (to the Hotri), 'Recite (the invitatory prayer) to Agni and Soma for the omentum and the suet of the victim!'

analyzed: hiraṇya śakalam avadadhāti atha upariṣṭāt dvis ājyasya abhighārayati
translated: He then puts down a piece of gold, and bastes (the omentum) twice with ghee from above.

analyzed: tat yat hiraṇya śakalau abhitas bhavataḥ  ghnanti vai etat paśum yat agnau
translated: And as to why there are two pieces of gold on each side:

original: juhvatyamṛtamāyurhiraṇyaṃ tadamṛta āyuṣi pratitiṣṭhati tathāta udeti tathā saṃjīvati
analyzed: juhvati amṛtam āyuḥ hiraṇyam tat amṛte āyuṣi pratitiṣṭhati tathā atas udeti tathā saṃjīvati
translated: when they offer an animal in the fire, they kill it; and gold is immortal life: it thus stands firm in immortal life, and so it rises again, and so it comes to life.

original: tasmāddhiraṇyaśakalāvabhito bhavata āśrāvyāhāgnīṣomābhyāṃ cāgasya vapām medaḥ
analyzed: tasmāt hiraṇya śakalau abhitas bhavataḥ āśrāvya āha agnīṣomābhyām ca agasya vapām medaḥ
translated: For this reason there are two pieces of gold on each side. Having called for the Sraushat, he says (to the Maitrâvaruna), 'Prompt (the Hotri to recite the offering prayer) for the omentum and the suet of the victim to Agni and Soma!'

original: preṣyeti na prasthitamityāha prasute prasthitamiti vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti / / /
analyzed: preṣya iti na prasthitam iti āha prasute prasthitam iti vaṣaṭkṛte juhoti
translated: 'The started (oblation)' he does not say; but when the Prasa has been started, (he says), 'The started (oblation).' At the Vashat-call he offers.

original: hutvā vapāṃ samīcyau /🔽vapāśrapaṇyau kṛtvānuprāsyati svāhākṛte ūrdhvanabhasam
analyzed: hutvā vapām samīcyau  vapāśrapaṇyau kṛtvā anuprāsyati svāhākṛte ūrdhva nabhasam
translated: Having offered the omentum, he turns the two spits round,

original: mārutaṃ gacatamiti nedime amuyā sato yābhyāṃ vapāmaśiśrapāmeti / / /🔽tadyadvapayā caranti /🔽yasyai vai devatāyai paśumālabhante tāmevaitaddevatāmetena
analyzed: mārutam gacatam iti na id ime amuyā sataḥ yābhyām vapām aśiśrapāma iti 🔽tat yat vapayā caranti 🔽yasyai vai devatāyai paśum ālabhante tām eva etad devatām etena
translated: and throws them on the omentum-spit. 'To the one who has been worshipped, to the one who has ascended to the sky, to the Maruts go ye!' he says, 'lest these two, by whom we have roasted the omentum, should be left here without (their share).'

original: medhena prīṇāti saiṣā devataitena medhena prītā śāntottarāṇi havīṃṣi
analyzed: medhena prīṇāti sā eṣā devatā etena medhena prītā śānta uttarāṇi havīṃṣi
translated: He delights it with the sacrificial essence. This deity, delighted with the sacrificial essence, is appeased. The other oblations are cooked.

analyzed: śrapyamāṇāni uparamati tasmāt vapayā caranti
translated: They stop while being cooked. Therefore they perform with the omentum.

analyzed: atha cātvāle mārjayante
translated: Then they sprinkle themselves at the cātvāla.

analyzed: krūrī vai etat kurvanti yat saṃjñapayanti yat viśāsati
translated: They do something cruel when they kill and cut up (the animal).

original: sāntirāpastadadbhiḥ śāntyā śamayante tadadbhiḥ saṃdadhate tasmāccātvāle mārjayante / / / / / /
analyzed: sāntiḥ āpaḥ tat adbhiḥ śāntyā śamayante tat adbhiḥ saṃdadhate tasmāt cātvāle mārjayante  /
translated: Water is a means of soothing. They soothe it with that soothing water, they join it with that water. Therefore they sprinkle themselves at the cātvāla.

analyzed: yad devatyaḥ paśuḥ bhavati
translated: To whatever deity the animal belongs,

analyzed: tad devatyam puroḍāśam anunirvapati
translated: he offers a cake to that deity afterwards.

original: tadyatpuroḍāśamanunirvapati sarveṣāṃ vā eṣa paśūnām medho yadvrīhiyavau🔽tenaivainametanmedhena samardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti tasmātpuroḍāśamanunirvapati / / /
analyzed: tat yat puroḍāśam anunirvapati sarveṣām vai eṣa paśūnām medhaḥ yat vrīhi yavau  tena eva enam etat medhena samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti tasmāt puroḍāśam anunirvapati
translated: The reason why he offers a cake afterwards is that rice and barley are the sacrificial essence of all animals.🔽With that sacrificial essence he makes it whole, he completes it. Therefore he offers a cake afterwards.

original: atha yadvapayā pracarya /🔽etena puroḍāśena pracarati madhyato vā imāṃ
analyzed: atha yat vapayā pracarya  etena puroḍāśena pracarati madhyatas vai imām
translated: Then why he proceeds with this cake after performing with the omentum.🔽They cut out this omentum from the middle of the animal.

original: vapāmutkhidanti madhyata evainametena medhena samardhayati kṛtsnaṃ karoti
analyzed: vapām utkhidanti madhyatas eva enam etena medhena samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti
translated: From the middle he makes it whole, he completes it with that sacrificial essence.

original: tasmādvapayā pracaryaitena puroḍāśena pracaratyeṣa nvevaitasya bandhuryatra kva
analyzed: tasmāt vapayā pracarya etena puroḍāśena pracarati eṣa nu eva etasya bandhuḥ yatra kva
translated: Therefore, having performed with the omentum, he performs with this sacrificial cake. This, indeed, is the relation of this (cake) wherever it may be.

analyzed: ca eṣa paśum puroḍāśaḥ nunirupyate
translated: Therefore, having performed with the omentum, he performs with this sacrificial cake. This, indeed, is the relation of it, wherever this sacrificial cake is offered after the animal sacrifice.

analyzed: atha paśum viśāsti
translated: Then he instructs the animal.

analyzed: tris pracyāvayatāt tris pracyutasya hṛdayam uttamam kurutāt iti
translated: Let him be shaken three times, and make the heart the uppermost of the three times shaken.

analyzed: trivṛt hi yajñaḥ
translated: For the sacrifice is threefold.

analyzed: atha śamitāram saṃśāsti
translated: Then he instructs the Samitr.

original: yattvā pṛcācūtaṃ haviḥ śamitāriti śṛtamityeva brūtānna śṛtam
analyzed: yat tvā pṛcācūtam haviḥ śamitar iti śṛtam iti eva brūta anna śṛtam
translated: If he should ask thee, Is the oblation cooked, O Samitr? thou must say, It is cooked, not It is not cooked.

analyzed: bhagavaḥ na śṛtam hi iti
translated: Sir, it is not cooked.

original: atha juhvā pṛṣadājyasyopahatya /🔽adhvaryurupaniṣkramya pṛcati śṛtaṃ haviḥ
analyzed: atha juhvā pṛṣadājyasya upahatya  adhvaryuḥ upaniṣkramya pṛcati śṛtam haviḥ
translated: Then, having taken up the coagulated milk with the Juhu ladle,🔽the Adhvaryu, having gone out, asks, Is the oblation cooked, O Samitr?

analyzed: śamitar iti śṛtam iti āha tat devānām iti upāṃśu adhvaryuḥ
translated: It is cooked, he says. That is for the gods, the Adhvaryu in a low voice.

analyzed: tat yat pṛcati
translated: Now the reason why he asks is this.

original: śṛtaṃ vai devānāṃ havirnāśṛtaṃ śamitā vai tadveda yadi śṛtaṃ vā
analyzed: śṛtam vai devānām haviḥ na a śṛtam śamitā vai tat veda yadi śṛtam vā
translated: The oblation of the gods is indeed cooked, not uncooked. The Samitr knows that if it is cooked

analyzed: bhavati a śṛtam vā
translated: or if it is uncooked.

analyzed: tat yat pṛcati
translated: Now the reason why he asks is this.

original: śṛtena pracarāṇīti tadyadyaśṛtam bhavati śṛtameva devānāṃ
analyzed: śṛtena pracarāṇi iti tat yadi a śṛtam bhavati śṛtam eva devānām
translated: I shall proceed with the cooked, thus if it is uncooked, then it is indeed cooked for the gods.

original: havirbhavati śṛtaṃ yajamānasyānenā adhvaryurbhavati śamitari tadeno bhavati
analyzed: haviḥ bhavati śṛtam yajamānasya anenāḥ adhvaryuḥ bhavati śamitari tat enaḥ bhavati
translated: The oblation becomes cooked for the sacrificer. The Adhvaryu becomes the slayer. That is his sin.

original: triṣkṛtvaḥ pṛcati trivṛddhi yajño 'tha yadāha taddevānāmiti taddhi devānāṃ yacūtaṃ
analyzed: triṣkṛtvaḥ pṛcati trivṛt hi yajñaḥ yat āha tat devānām iti tat hi devānām
translated: He asks three times. The sacrifice is threefold. Then when he says 'that of the gods', that indeed belongs to the gods, what is cooked.

analyzed: tasmāt āha tat devānām iti
translated: Therefore he says 'that of the gods'.

analyzed: sa hṛdayam eva agre bhighārayati
translated: He bastes the heart first.

analyzed: ātmā vai manaḥ hṛdayam prāṇaḥ
translated: The mind is the self, the heart is the mind, the breath is the self.

analyzed: pṛṣadājyam ātmani eva etat manasi prāṇam dadhāti tathā etat jīvam eva devānām
translated: The speckled ghee is placed in the self, in the mind, the breath. Thus this oblation of the gods becomes living,

analyzed: haviḥ bhavati amṛtam amṛtānām
translated: the immortal of the immortals.

analyzed: saḥ bhighārayati
translated: He bastes it.

original: saṃ te mano manasā sam prāṇaḥ prāṇena gacatāmiti na svāhākaroti
analyzed: sam te manaḥ manasā sam prāṇaḥ prāṇena gacatām iti na svāhākaroti
translated: 'May thy mind go together with the mind, thy breath with the breath', he says. He does not say 'Svâhâ!'

analyzed: na hi eṣā āhutiḥ udvāsayanti paśum
translated: For this is not an oblation. They lead the animal away.

original: taṃ jaghanena cātvālamantareṇa yūpaṃ cāgniṃ ca haranti /
analyzed: tam jaghanena cātvālam antareṇa yūpam ca agnim ca haranti
translated: They carry it between the stake and the fire, behind the pit.

original: tadyatsamayā na haranti🔽yenānyāni havīṃṣi haranti śṛtaṃ santaṃ nedaṅgaśo vikṛttena krūrīkṛtena samayā
analyzed: tat yat samayā na haranti  yena anyāni havīṃṣi haranti śṛtam santam na id aṅgaśas vikṛttena krūrīkṛtena samayā
translated: The reason why they do not carry it along the range,🔽along which they carry the other oblations, is lest they should touch the sacrifice with what is cut up into parts, with what is made cruel.

original: yajñam prasajāmeti yadu bāhyena na harantyagreṇa yūpam bahirdhā ha
analyzed: yajñam prasajāma iti yat u bāhyena na haranti agreṇa yūpam bahirdhā ha
translated: The reason why they do not carry it outside is lest they should place it outside the sacrifice.

original: yajñātkuryustasmādantareṇa yūpaṃ cāgniṃ ca haranti dakṣiṇato nidhāya
analyzed: yajñāt kuryuḥ tasmāt antareṇa yūpam ca agnim ca haranti dakṣiṇatas nidhāya
translated: Therefore they carry it between the sacrificial post and the fire. Having placed it on the south side,

analyzed: pratiprasthātā avadyati plakṣa śākhāḥ uttarabarhiḥ bhavanti tāḥ adhi avadyati
translated: the Pratiprasthātṛ cuts it. The branches of the fig tree are the northern sacrificial grass. He cuts (the flesh) over them.

analyzed: tat yat plakṣa śākhāḥ uttarabarhiḥ bhavanti  yatra vai devāḥ
translated: As to why the branches of the fig tree are the northern sacrificial grass.

original: tryaṅgyasya doṣṇo gudaṃ dvedhā kṛtvāvadyati tryaṅgyāyai śroṇeratha
analyzed: tryaṅgyasya doṣṇaḥ gudam dvedhā kṛtvā avadyati tryaṅgyāyai śroṇeḥ atha

translated: Having caused (the Agnîdh) to announce, he says, 'Prompt (the Hotri to recite the yâgyâ) to Sviṣṭakṛt Agni!' When he says, 'Vashat!' he offers.

analyzed: atha yat vasā homasya pariśiṣyate  tena diśaḥ vyāghārayati diśaḥ pradiśaḥ ādiśaḥ vidiśa

analyzed: uddiśaḥ digbhyaḥ svāhā iti rasaḥ vai vasā homaḥ sarvāsu eva etat dikṣu rasam dadhāti

translated: therefore sap is found in all the quarters.

analyzed: etarhi sammarśanasya kālaḥ yat purā samṛśati yaḥ ima
translated: This is the time for touching; if he were to touch it before, then he would touch it in vain;

original: upatiṣṭhante te vimathiṣyanta iti śaṅkamāno yadyu vimāthānna śaṅketātraiva

translated: If he fears that they will break up while being attended to, if he does not fear breaking up here itself,

analyzed: sammṛśet
translated: fearing lest they should destroy it while it is being put together, if he should not fear lest it be destroyed while being put together, he should touch it here only.

original: aindraḥ prāṇaḥ /🔽aṅgeaṅge nidīdhyadaindra udāno aṅgeaṅge nidhīta iti yadaṅgaśo🔽vikṛtto bhavati tatprāṇodānābhyāṃ saṃdadhāti deva tvaṣṭarbhūri te saṃsametu🔽salakṣmā yadviṣurūpam bhavātīti kṛtsnavṛtamevaitatkaroti devatrā yantamavase
analyzed: aindraḥ prāṇaḥ  aṅge aṅge nidīdhyat aindraḥ udānaḥ aṅge aṅge nidhīte iti yat aṅgaśas  vikṛttaḥ bhavati tat prāṇa udānābhyām saṃdadhāti deva tvaṣṭar bhūri te saṃsametu  salakṣmā yat viṣurūpam bhavāti iti kṛtsna vṛtam eva etat karoti devatrā yantam avase
translated: The breath is connected with Indra.

original: sakhāyo 'nu tvā mātāpitaro madantviti tadyatrainamahauṣīttadenaṃ kṛtsnaṃ
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ nu tvā mātā pitaraḥ madantu iti tat yatra enam ahauṣīt tat enam kṛtsnam
translated: Let it be settled in every limb, the up-breathing connected with Indra, let it be settled in every limb. Where it is cut up in parts, he joins it together with the out-breathing and the up-breathing. May the god Tvastr unite for thee the broken bones, whatever is in thee defective or out of joint. He makes it whole, as it were. To thee, O god, going to the gods for help, let the friends rejoice, let thy mother and father rejoice. Where he has laid it down, there he makes it whole,

analyzed: kṛtvā anusamasyati saḥ sya kṛtsnaḥ muṣmin loke ātmā bhavati
translated: and puts it together again. Its whole self becomes in yonder world.

analyzed: trīṇi ha vai paśoḥ ekādaśāni
translated: There are three groups of eleven in the animal.

original: ekādaśa prayājā ekādaśānuyājā ekādaśopayajo daśa🔽pāṇyā aṅgulayo daśa pādyā daśa prāṇāḥ prāṇa udāno vyāna ityetāvānvai puruṣo yaḥ
analyzed: ekādaśa prayājāḥ ekādaśa anuyājāḥ ekādaśa upayajaḥ daśa  pāṇyāḥ aṅgulayaḥ daśa pādyāḥ daśa prāṇāḥ prāṇaḥ udānaḥ vyānaḥ iti etāvān vai puruṣaḥ yaḥ
translated: There are eleven fore-sacrifices, eleven after-sacrifices, eleven after-sacrifices, ten

analyzed: parārdhyaḥ paśūnām yam sarve nu paśavaḥ
translated: hands, ten fingers, ten feet, ten toes, ten vital airs, the out-breathing, the up-breathing, and the through-breathing. So great is man, who is the highest of animals, after whom all other animals are named.

original: tadāhuḥ / kiṃ tadyajñe kriyate yena prāṇaḥ sarvebhyo 'ṅgebhyaḥ śiva iti / / /
analyzed: tat āhuḥ kim tat yajñe kriyate yena prāṇaḥ sarvebhyaḥ ṅgebhyaḥ śivaḥ iti
translated: As to this they say, 'What is done at the sacrifice whereby the breath is propitious to all the limbs?'

analyzed: yat eva gudam tredhā karoti
translated: When he divides the anus into three parts.

original: prāṇo vai gudaḥ so 'yam prāṅātatastamayam prāṇo🔽'nusaṃcarati / / /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ vai gudaḥ saḥ yam prāṅ atatastamayam prāṇaḥ  nusaṃcarati
translated: The anus is the breath; it is stretched out in front; the breath follows it here.

analyzed: sa yat eva gudam tredhā karoti
translated: When he divides the anus into three parts,

analyzed: tṛtīyam upayaḍbhyaḥ tṛtīyam juhvām tṛtīyam upabhṛti
translated: one third for the Upâmsu, one third for the Juhu, one third for the Upabhrit,

original: tena prāṇaḥ sarvebhyo 'ṅgebhyaḥ śivaḥ / / /🔽sa ha tveva paśumālabheta /🔽ya enam medhamupanayedyadi kṛśaḥ syādyadudaryasya
analyzed: tena prāṇaḥ sarvebhyaḥ ṅgebhyaḥ śivaḥ  sa ha tu eva paśum ālabheta  yaḥ enam medham upanayet yadi kṛśaḥ syāt yat udaryasya
translated: thereby the breath is propitious to all the limbs.🔽He should, however, immolate an animal for him who would lead him up to the sacrificial food. If he be lean,

original: medasaḥ pariśiṣyata tadgude nyṛṣetprāṇo vai gudaḥ so 'yam prāṅātatastamayam
analyzed: medasaḥ pariśiṣyata tat gude nyṛṣet prāṇaḥ vai gudaḥ saḥ yam prāṅ ātataḥ tam ayam
translated: what remains of the fat of the belly he should put into the anus; the anus is the breath; it is stretched out in front; the breath follows it here.

original: prāṇo 'nusaṃcarati prāṇo vai paśuryāvaddhyeva prāṇena prāṇiti tāvatpaśuratha
analyzed: prāṇaḥ nusaṃcarati prāṇaḥ vai paśuḥ yāvat hi eva prāṇena prāṇiti tāvat paśuḥ atha
translated: The animal is the breath; for as long as it breathes by the breath, so long is it an animal;

analyzed: yadā asmāt prāṇaḥ upakrāmati dāru eva tarhi bhūtaḥ narthyaḥ śete
translated: but when the breath departs from it, then it lies there as useless as a piece of wood.

analyzed: gudaḥ vai paśuḥ
translated: The animal is the anus;

original: medo vai medhastadenam medhamupanayati yadyu aṃsalo bhavati
analyzed: medaḥ vai medhaḥ tat enam medham upanayati yat yu aṃsalaḥ bhavati
translated: the sacrificial food is fat; he thus leads him up to the sacrificial food. If, however, he be lean,

analyzed: svayam upetaḥ eva tarhi medham bhavati
translated: Then the sacrificial essence comes to him of itself.

original: atha pṛṣadājyaṃ gṛhṇāti /🔽dvayaṃ vā idaṃ sarpiścaiva dadhi ca dvandvaṃ vai
analyzed: atha pṛṣadājyam gṛhṇāti  dvayam vai idam sarpiḥ ca eva dadhi ca dvandvam vai
translated: Then he takes the speckled butter.

analyzed: mithunam prajananam mithunam eva etat prajananam kriyate
translated: For this is a pair, butter and curds, a pair is a productive union, a productive union is thus produced.

original: tenānuyājeṣu carati /🔽paśavo vā anuyājāḥ payaḥ pṛṣadājyaṃ tatpaśuṣvevaitatpayo
analyzed: tena anuyājeṣu carati  paśavaḥ vai anuyājāḥ payaḥ pṛṣadājyam tat paśuṣu eva etat payaḥ
translated: With that he performs the after-sacrifices.

original: dadhāti tadidam paśuṣu payo hitam prāṇo hi pṛṣadājyamannaṃ hi
analyzed: dadhāti tat idam paśuṣu payaḥ hitam prāṇaḥ hi pṛṣadājyam annam hi
translated: The after-sacrifices are the cattle, the speckled butter is the milk, he thus puts milk into the cattle, that is this milk which is put into the cattle, for the speckled butter is the breath,

analyzed: pṛṣadājyam annam hi prāṇaḥ
translated: the speckled butter is food, for the breath is food.

original: tena purastādanuyājeṣu carati /🔽sa yo 'yam purastātprāṇastamevaitaddadhāti tena
analyzed: tena purastāt anuyājeṣu carati  sa yaḥ yam purastāt prāṇaḥ tam eva etat dadhāti tena
translated: With that he performs in front of the after-sacrifices.🔽He thus puts into it that breath which is in front.

original: paścādupayajati sa yo 'yam paścātprāṇastamevaitaddadhāti tāvimā ubhayataḥ prāṇau
analyzed: paścāt upayajati sa yaḥ yam paścāt prāṇaḥ tam eva etat dadhāti tau imau ubhayatas prāṇau
translated: With that he sacrifices behind, he thus puts into it that breath which is behind. These two breaths are thus put in on both sides,

analyzed: hitau yaḥ ca ayam upariṣṭāt yaḥ ca adhastāt  tat vai etat ekaḥ dvābhyām vaṣaṭkaroti
translated: that which is above and that which is below.

analyzed: adhvaryave ca yaḥ ca eṣaḥ upayajati atha
translated: Now, he utters the Vasat call with one of these two for both, to the Adhvaryu and to him who sacrifices the Upâmsu.

analyzed: yat yajantam upayajati tasmāt upayajaḥ nāma atha yat upayajati pra eva etat janayati
translated: But when he sacrifices to him who is sacrificing, therefore it is called Upâmsu. And when he sacrifices to him, he produces him anew.

analyzed: paścāt hi upayajati paścāt hi yoṣāyai prajāḥ prajāyante
translated: For offspring are born to the woman from behind.

analyzed: saḥ upayajati
translated: He makes the Upâmsu libation.

original: samudraṃ gaca svāhetyāpo vai samudra āpo reto reta evaitatsiñcati / / /🔽antarikṣaṃ gaca svāheti /
analyzed: samudram gaca svāhā iti āpaḥ vai samudraḥ āpaḥ retaḥ retaḥ eva etat siñcati  antarikṣam gaca svāhā iti
translated: 'Go to the ocean, Hail!' The ocean is the waters; seed is water: he thus pours seed.

analyzed: antarikṣam vai anu prajāḥ prajāyante ntarikṣam eva etat anu  prajanayati
translated: 'Go to the sky, Hail!' For offspring are born along the sky: he thus causes them to be born along the sky.

original: devaṃ savitāraṃ gaca svāheti savitā vai devānām prasavitā savitṛprasūta🔽evaitatprajanayati / / /🔽mitrāvaruṇau gaca svāheti /🔽prāṇodānau vai mitrāvaruṇau prāṇodānāvevaitatprajāsu🔽dadhāti / / /
analyzed: devam savitāram gaca svāhā iti savitā vai devānām prasavitā savitṛ prasūta  eva etat prajanayati  mitrāvaruṇau gaca svāhā iti  prāṇa udānau vai mitrāvaruṇau prāṇa udānau eva etat prajāsu  dadhāti
translated: 'Go to the god Savitri, Hail!' Savitri is the impeller of the gods: impelled by Savitri he thus causes them to be born.

original: ahorātre gaca svāheti /🔽ahorātre vā anu prajāḥ prajāyante 'horātre evaitadanu🔽prajanayati / / /
analyzed: ahar rātre gaca svāhā iti  ahar rātre vai anu prajāḥ prajāyante hara rātre eva etat anu  prajanayati
translated: 'Go to Mitra and Varuna, Hail!' Mitra and Varuna are the out-breathing and in-breathing: he thus lays into the creatures out-breathing and in-breathing.

original: candāṃsi gaca svāheti /🔽sapta vai candāṃsi sapta grāmyāḥ paśavaḥ
analyzed: candāṃsi gaca svāhā iti  sapta vai candāṃsi sapta grāmyāḥ paśavaḥ
translated: 'Go to day and night, Hail!' For offspring are born along day and night: he thus causes them to be born along day and night.

analyzed: sapta āraṇyāḥ tān eva etat ubhayān prajanayati
translated: 'Go to the metres, Hail!' There are seven metres, seven domestic animals, seven wild ones: he thus causes both of them to be born.

analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī gaca svāhā iti
translated: 'Go to heaven and earth, Hail!'

original: prajāpatirvai prajāḥ sṛṣṭvā tā dyāvāpṛthivībhyām🔽paryagṛhṇāttā imā dyāvāpṛthivībhyām parigṛhītāstatho evaiṣa etatprajāḥ sṛṣṭvā tā
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ vai prajāḥ sṛṣṭvā tāḥ dyāvāpṛthivībhyām  paryagṛhṇāt tāḥ imāḥ dyāvāpṛthivībhyām parigṛhītāḥ tathā u eva eṣa etat prajāḥ sṛṣṭvā tāḥ
translated: Prajapati, having created the people, enclosed them with heaven and earth;🔽these people are enclosed by heaven and earth. In the same way he, having created the people, encloses them with heaven and earth.

analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivībhyām parigṛhṇāti
translated: Pragâpati, having created living beings, enclosed them on all sides by the two, heaven and earth; and thus enclosed are these two, heaven and earth. And in like manner does he now, having created living beings, enclose them on all sides by the two, heaven and earth.

analyzed: atha atyupayajati
translated: He then performs the aty-upajit offerings.

original: sa yannātyupayajedyāvatyo haivāgre prajāḥ sṛṣṭāstāvatyo haiva🔽syurna prajāyerannatha yadatyupayajati praivaitajjanayati tasmādimāḥ prajāḥ
analyzed: sa yat na atyupayajet yāvatyaḥ ha eva agre prajāḥ sṛṣṭāḥ tāvatyaḥ ha eva  syuḥ na prajāyeran atha yat atyupayajati pra eva etat janayati tasmāt imāḥ prajāḥ
translated: Were he not to perform the aty-upajit offerings, the creatures would be just so many as were created at first;

analyzed: punar abhyāvartam prajāyante
translated: they would not be reproduced. But inasmuch as he performs the aty-upajit offerings, he causes them to be reproduced: hence these creatures are reproduced again and again.

analyzed: sā u ti upayajati
translated: He performs the aty-upajit offerings.

original: yajñaṃ gaca svāhetyāpo vai yajña āpo reto reta evaitatsiñcati / / /🔽somaṃ gaca svāheti /
analyzed: yajñam gaca svāhā iti āpaḥ vai yajñaḥ āpaḥ retaḥ retaḥ eva etat siñcati  somam gaca svāhā iti
translated: 'Go to the sacrifice, Hail!' The sacrifice doubtless is the waters: he thus casts seed into the waters.

original: reto vai somo reta evaitatsiñcati / / /🔽divyaṃ nabho gaca svāheti /
analyzed: retaḥ vai somaḥ retaḥ eva etat siñcati  divyam nabhaḥ gaca svāhā iti
translated: 'Go to Soma, Hail!' Soma doubtless is seed: he thus casts seed.

original: āpo vai divyaṃ nabha āpo reto reta evaitatsiñcati / / /🔽agniṃ vaiśvānaraṃ gaca svāheti /
analyzed: āpaḥ vai divyam nabhaḥ āpaḥ retaḥ retaḥ eva etat siñcati  agnim vaiśvānaram gaca svāhā iti
translated: 'Go to the heavenly ether, Hail!' The heavenly ether doubtless is the waters: he thus casts seed into the waters.

analyzed: iyam vai pṛthivī agniḥ vaiśvānaraḥ sā iyam
translated: 'Go to Agni Vaisvânara, Hail!' Agni Vaisvânara doubtless is this earth: he thus causes this foundation to be reproduced.

analyzed: pratiṣṭhā imām eva etat pratiṣṭhām abhiprajanayati
translated: 'Go to the sun, Hail!' The sun doubtless is the highest deity: he thus causes the highest deity to be reproduced.

original: atha mukhaṃ vimṛṣṭe /🔽mano me hārdi yaceti tatho hopayaṣṭātmānaṃ
analyzed: atha mukham vimṛṣṭe  manaḥ me hārdi tathā u ha upayaṣṭā ātmānam
translated: Then he wipes his mouth,

analyzed: na anupravṛṇakti
translated: with the text, 'My mind has gone into my heart;' thus the Upasad priest does not follow the self🔽of the sacrificer.

original: atha jāghanyā patnīḥ saṃyājayanti /🔽jaghanārdho vai jāghanī jaghanārdhādvai
analyzed: atha jāghanyā patnīḥ saṃyājayanti  jaghana ardhaḥ vai jāghanī jaghana ardhāt vai
translated: Then they perform the Patnîsamyâgas with the tail.

original: yoṣāyai prajāḥ prajāyante tatpraivaitajjanayati yajjāghanyā patnīḥ saṃyājayanti / / /
analyzed: yoṣāyai prajāḥ prajāyante tat pra eva etat janayati yat jāghanyā patnīḥ saṃyājayanti
translated: The tail is the hind part; from the hind part of the female offspring are born; he thus produces offspring by the tail, in that they perform the Patnîsamyâgas with the tail.

analyzed: antarataḥ devānām patnībhyaḥ vadyati
translated: He cuts off (the portions) from within the (hind-part of the animal) for the wives of the gods;

analyzed: antarataḥ vai yoṣāyai prajāḥ prajāyanta
translated: from within the female offspring are born;

original: upariṣṭādagnaye gṛhapataya upariṣṭādvai vṛṣā yoṣām adhidravati / / /
analyzed: upariṣṭāt agnaye gṛhapataye upariṣṭāt vai vṛṣā yoṣām adhidravati
translated: from above (he cuts off) for Agni, the lord of the house; from above the male approaches the female.

original: atha hṛdayaśūlenāvabhṛthaṃ yanti /🔽paśorha vā ālabhyamānasya hṛdayaṃ
analyzed: atha hṛdayaśūlena avabhṛtham yanti  paśoḥ ha vai ālabhyamānasya hṛdayam
translated: Then they go to the Avabhritha with the spit.

analyzed: śukṣam abhyavaiti hṛdayāt hṛdayaśūlam atha yat ṛtasya paritṛndanti tat alaṃjuṣam
translated: When an animal is immolated, the fat flows into its heart; from the heart (it flows into) the spit; and what they cut from the animal, that is the fat.

original: tasmādu paritṛdyaiva śūlākuryāttattriḥpracyute paśau hṛdayam pravṛhyottamam
analyzed: tasmāt u paritṛdya eva śūlākuryāt tat tris pracyute paśau hṛdayam pravṛhya uttamam
translated: Therefore he should only put the spit on the fire after having cut (the animal). When the animal has been thrice turned, he takes out the heart and puts it on the top

analyzed: pratyavadadhāti
translated: (of the spit).

analyzed: atha hṛdayaśūlam prayacati
translated: Then he hands the spit to (the Adhvaryu).

analyzed: tat na pṛthivyām parāsyet na apsu sa yat pṛthivyām
translated: He must not let it fall on the earth, nor into the water. If he were to let it fall on the earth,

analyzed: parāsyet oṣadhīḥ ca vanaspatīn ca eṣā śuc praviśet yat apsu parāsyet apaḥ eṣā
translated: If it were to be cast out on the earth, it would enter the plants and trees; if it were to be cast out on the water, it would enter the water.

analyzed: śuc praviśet tasmāt na pṛthivyām na apsu
translated: Therefore, neither on the earth nor on the water.

analyzed: apaḥ eva abhyavetya
translated: He should go to the water.

original: yatra śuṣkasya cārdrasya ca saṃdhiḥ syāttadupagūhedyadyu
analyzed: yatra śuṣkasya ca ārdrasya ca saṃdhiḥ syāt tat upagūhet yadi
translated: If it were to dry up on the way, he should collect it where there is a junction of dry and wet, or

original: abhyavāyanāya glāyedagreṇa yūpamudapātraṃ ninīya yatra śuṣkasya cārdrasya ca
analyzed: abhyavāyanāya glāyet agreṇa yūpam uda pātram ninīya yatra śuṣkasya ca ārdrasya ca
translated: if it were to dry up on the way, he should pour the water vessel in front of the sacrificial post where there is a junction of dry and wet, and collect it there.

original: saṃdhirbhavati tadupagūhati nāpo nauṣadhīrhiṃsīriti tathā nāpo nauṣadhīrhinasti
analyzed: saṃdhiḥ bhavati tat upagūhati na apaḥ na oṣadhīḥ hiṃsīḥ iti tathā na apaḥ na oṣadhīḥ hinasti
translated: He says, Do not injure the water or the plants, so that he does not injure the water or the plants.

original: dhāmnodhāmno rājaṃstato varuṇa no muñca yadāhuraghnyā iti varuṇeti śapāmahe
analyzed: dhāmnaḥ dhāmnaḥ rājan tatas varuṇa naḥ muñca yat āhuḥ aghnyāḥ iti varuṇa iti śapāmahe
translated: From every abode, O king Varuna, from there, O Varuna, do thou deliver us, that which they call the irredeemable, O Varuna, we swear.

analyzed: tatas varuṇa naḥ muñca iti tat enam sarvasmāt varuṇa pāśāt sarvasmāt varuṇyāt pramuñcati
translated: From there, O Varuna, do thou deliver us, thus he delivers him from every noose of Varuna, from every sin of Varuna.

original: athābhimantrayate /🔽sumitriyā na āpa oṣadhayaḥ santu durmitriyāstasmai santu yo
analyzed: atha abhimantrayate  su mitriyāḥ naḥ āpaḥ oṣadhayaḥ santu durmitriyāḥ tasmai santu yaḥ
translated: Then he recites (the verse),🔽May the waters and plants be friendly to us, unfriendly to him who hates us and whom we hate. Where they perform with this (verse), the waters and plants indeed

original: 'smāndveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣma iti yatra vā etena pracarantyāpaśca ha vā
analyzed: smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ iti yatra vai etena pracaranti āpaḥ ca ha vā
translated: are friendly to them, unfriendly to him who hates them and whom they hate.

original: asmāttāvadoṣadhayaścāpakramyeva tiṣṭhanti tadu tābhirmitradheyaṃ kurute tatho
analyzed: asmāt tāvat oṣadhayaḥ ca apakramya iva tiṣṭhanti tat u tābhiḥ mitradheyam kurute tathā u
translated: For from him the plants recede and stand aloof. He makes peace with them by that (offering).

original: hainaṃ tāḥ punaḥ praviśantyeṣo tatra prāyaścittiḥ kriyate sa vai nāgnīṣomīyasya
analyzed: ha enam tāḥ punar praviśanti eṣā u tatra prāyaścittiḥ kriyate sa vai na agnīṣomīyasya
translated: Thus, indeed, they again enter into him. That expiation is performed there. He does not perform it for the animal to Agni and Soma,

original: paśoḥ karoti nāgneyasya vaśāyā evānūbandhyāyai tāṃ hi sarvo 'nu yajñaḥ saṃtiṣṭhata
analyzed: paśoḥ karoti na āgneyasya vaśāyai eva anūbandhyāyai tām hi sarvaḥ nu yajñaḥ saṃtiṣṭhata
translated: nor for the one to Agni, but only for the barren cow to be offered subsequently, for the whole sacrifice is completed with that (offering).

original: etadu hāsyāgnīṣomīyasya ca paśorāgneyasya ca hṛdayaśūlena caritam bhavati
analyzed: etat u ha asya agnīṣomīyasya ca paśoḥ āgneyasya ca hṛdayaśūlena caritam bhavati
translated: This, indeed, is performed for him with the spit for the heart of the animal to Agni and Soma and the one to Agni.

analyzed: yat vaśāyāḥ caranti
translated: When they offer the barren cow.

analyzed: prajāpatiḥ vai prajāḥ sasṛjānaḥ riricānaḥ iva amanyata
translated: Prajapati, begetting the people, felt as if he were slipping away.

analyzed: tasmāt parācyaḥ prajāḥ āsuḥ na asya
translated: From him the people went away to the west.

analyzed: prajāḥ śriye nnādyāya tasthire
translated: They did not stand by him for glory and food.

original: sa aikṣatārikṣyaham /🔽asmā u kāmāyāsṛkṣi na me sa kāmaḥ samārdhi parācyo
analyzed: sa aikṣata arikṣī aham  asmai u kāmāya asṛkṣi na me sa kāmaḥ samārdhi parācyaḥ

analyzed: te ha devāḥ ūcuḥ  iyam u nu eva iha nāṣṭrā yat ime gandharvāḥ katham nu imam abhaye

analyzed: gardhiṣyanti atha etam abhaye nāṣṭre yajñasya rasam āhariṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: Then we shall bring the essence of the sacrifice to a place free from danger and harm.

original: te saha patnībhirīyuḥ /🔽te patnīṣveva gandharvā jagṛdhurathaitamabhaye nāṣṭre
analyzed: te saha patnībhiḥ īyuḥ  te patnīṣu eva gandharvāḥ jagṛdhuḥ atha etam abhaye nāṣṭre

analyzed: yajñasya rasam ājahruḥ
translated: The Gandharvas were indeed attached to the wives. Then they brought the essence of the sacrifice to a place free from danger and harm.

analyzed: tathā u eva eṣa etat
translated: In the same way, this (Sacrificer)

analyzed: mahā eva patnībhiḥ eti te patnīṣu eva gandharvā
translated: goes with his wives. The Gandharvas are indeed attached to the wives.

analyzed: gṛdhyanti atha etam abhaye nāṣṭre yajñasya rasam āharati
translated: Then he brings the essence of the sacrifice to a place free from danger and harm.

analyzed: saḥ pa u bhijuhoti

analyzed: etām ha vai āhutim hṛtām eṣa yajñasya rasaḥ upasameti tām

analyzed: yat u eva etām āhutim juhoti  etam eva etat yajñasya rasam abhiprastṛṇīte tam ārunddhe
translated: And, again, as to why he offers this oblation.🔽He pours that essence of the sacrifice forward, and secures it.

analyzed: tam apaḥ yācati yābhyaḥ u ca eva etām devatābhyaḥ āhutim juhoti tāḥ eva etat prīṇāti tāḥ asmai

analyzed: tṛptāḥ prītāḥ etam yajñasya rasam saṃnamanti  sa juhoti devīḥ apaḥ apāṃnapāt iti devyaḥ hi āpaḥ tasmāt āha devīḥ apaḥ apāṃnapāt iti  vaḥ ūrmiḥ haviṣyaḥ iti yaḥ vaḥ ūrmiḥ yajñiyaḥ iti eva etat āha indriyāvān madintamaḥ iti  vīryavān iti eva etat āha yat āha indriyāvān iti madintamaḥ iti svādiṣṭhaḥ iti eva etat āha tam
translated: being satisfied and gratified, bestow that essence of the sacrifice on him.🔽He offers, with , 'Ye divine waters, the child of the waters,'--for the waters are indeed divine: therefore he says, 'Ye divine waters, the child of the waters,'--'that wave which is meet for offering,'--that is, 'that wave which is meet for sacrifice;'--'rich in sap, most delightful,'--he thereby says, 'rich in strength, most delightful;'--'that do thou give to the gods to enjoy god-ward,'--this he asks of them when he says, 'that do thou give to the gods to enjoy god-ward.'

original: devebhyo devatrā dattetyetadenā ayāciṣṭa yadāha taṃ devebhyo devatrā datteti
analyzed: devebhyaḥ devatrā datta iti etat enāḥ ayāciṣṭa yat āha tam devebhyaḥ devatrā datta iti
translated: He offers, with , 'Ye divine waters, the child of the waters,'--for the waters are indeed divine: therefore he says, 'Ye divine waters, the child of the waters,'--'that wave which is meet for offering,'--that is, 'that wave which is meet for sacrifice;'--'rich in sap, most delightful,'--he thereby says, 'rich in strength, most delightful;'--'that do thou give to the gods to enjoy god-ward,'--this he asks of them when he says, 'that do thou give to the gods to enjoy god-ward.'

original: śukrapebhya iti satyaṃ vai śukraṃ satyapebhya ityevaitadāha yeṣām bhāga stha
analyzed: śukra pebhyaḥ iti satyam vai śukram satya pebhyaḥ iti eva etat āha yeṣām bhāgaḥ stha

analyzed: svāhā iti teṣām u hi eṣa bhāgaḥ
translated: 'Hail!' for it is indeed their share.

analyzed: atha maitrāvaruṇa camasena etām āhutim apaplāvayati
translated: He then pours this libation into the Maitravaruna's goblet.

original: kārṣirasīti yathā vā aṅgāro🔽'gninā psātaḥ syādevameṣāhutiretayā devatayā psātā bhavati rājānaṃ vā🔽etābhiradbhirupasrakṣyanbhavati yā etā maitrāvaruṇacamase vajro vā ājyaṃ retaḥ
analyzed: kārṣirasi iti yathā vai aṅgāraḥ  gninā psātaḥ syāt evam eṣā āhutiḥ etayā devatayā psātā bhavati rājānam vā  etābhiḥ adbhiḥ upasrakṣyan bhavati yāḥ etāḥ maitrāvaruṇa camase vajraḥ vai ājyam retaḥ
translated: 'Thou art a basin', he says; for as a piece of charcoal is burnt by the fire,🔽so is this libation burnt by this deity.

original: somo nedvajreṇājyena retaḥ somaṃ hinasānīti tasmādvā apaplāvayati / / /🔽atha gṛhṇāti /🔽samudrasya tvākṣityā unnayāmītyāpo vai samudro 'psvevaitadakṣitiṃ
analyzed: somaḥ na id vajreṇa ājyena retaḥ somam hinasāni iti tasmāt vai apaplāvayati  atha gṛhṇāti  samudrasya tvā akṣityai unnayāmi iti āpaḥ vai samudraḥ upsu eva etat akṣitim
translated: He is now about to sprinkle the king with these waters which are in the Maitravaruna's goblet; for the ghee is a thunderbolt, and the Soma is seed: 'Lest I should injure the seed, the Soma, with the thunderbolt, the ghee', thus he thinks, and therefore he pours (the ghee) into (the Soma).

original: dadhāti tasmādāpa etāvati bhoge bhujyamāne na kṣīyante
analyzed: dadhāti tasmāt āpaḥ etāvati bhoge bhujyamāne na kṣīyante
translated: He then takes (Soma) with, 'For the ocean's non-drying up I take thee,'--the ocean, doubtless, is the waters: in the waters he thus lays non-drying up (or abundance); whence the waters do not dry up in spite of being used up to that extent.

analyzed: tadanu ekadhanān unnayanti tadanu pānnejanān
translated: In like manner they take (Soma) for the one-ribbed (altars); and in like manner for the drinking-cups.

analyzed: tat yat maitrāvaruṇa camasena gṛhṇāti
translated: The reason why he takes (Soma) with the Maitravaruna's goblet is this.

analyzed: yatra vai devebhyaḥ yajñaḥ
translated: Now when the sacrifice was with the gods,

analyzed: pākrāmat tam etat devāḥ praiṣaiḥ eva praiṣam aican purorugbhiḥ
translated: 'The gods pursued it with the Praisas, they sought it with the Purorucs,

analyzed: prārocayan nividbhiḥ nyavedayan tasmāt maitrāvaruṇa camasena gṛhṇāti
translated: they made it shine with the Nivids, they made it known with the Nivids; therefore he draws (the Soma) in the Maitravaruna's goblet.'

original: ta āyanti / pratyupatiṣṭhate 'gnīccātvāle vasatīvarībhiśca hotṛcamasena ca sa🔽uparyupari cātvālaṃ saṃsparśayati vasatīvarīśca maitrāvaruṇacamasaṃ ca samāpo
analyzed: te āyanti pratyupatiṣṭhate gnīdh cātvāle vasatīvarībhiḥ ca hotṛ camasena ca sa  upari upari cātvālam saṃsparśayati vasatīvarīḥ ca maitrāvaruṇa camasam ca
translated: They come (to the Havirdhâna); the Adhvaryu stands by, and the Âgnîdhra by the Cûkûda, and the Vasatîvarî water and the Hotri's cup.

original: adbhiragmata samoṣadhībhiroṣadhīriti yaścāsau pūrvedyurāhṛto yajñasya raso
analyzed: adbhiḥ agmata sam oṣadhībhiḥ oṣadhīḥ iti yaḥ ca asau pūrvedyus āhṛtaḥ yajñasya rasaḥ

translated: and that which is drawn to-day, he thus combines both.

analyzed: tat ha eke eva maitrāvaruṇa camase vasatīvarīḥ nayantyā  maitrāvaruṇa camasāt vasatīvarīṣu yaḥ ca asau pūrvedyus āhṛtaḥ yajñasya  yaḥ ca adya āhṛtaḥ tam eva etat ubhayam saṃsṛjāmaḥ iti vadantaḥ tat u tathā na kuryāt yat vā
translated: Now some pour the Vasatîvarî water into the Maitravaruna's goblet,🔽and from the Maitravaruna's goblet into the Vasatîvarî water, saying, 'We thus combine both the essence of the sacrifice which was drawn yesterday,

analyzed: vasatīvarīḥ gṛhṇāti nigrābhyābhyaḥ tat yat upari upari cātvālam saṃsparśayati atas vai
translated: He draws the Vasatīvarī waters and the Nigrâbhyâs. The reason why he touches them one above the other beyond the pit is this.

translated: From thence the gods went up to heaven. He thereby points out to the Sacrificer the path to heaven.🔽They go (to the Sadas). The Hotri asks him, 'Adhvaryu, are the waters free from injury?'--that is, 'are the waters free from danger;'--

analyzed: pṛtsu martyam avāḥ vājeṣu yam junāḥ sa yantā śaśvatīḥ iṣaḥ svāhā iti āgneyyā  juhoti agniḥ vai agniṣṭomaḥ tat agnau agniṣṭomam pratiṣṭhāpayati martavatyā
translated: but if there be not enough for the offering, he takes another four spoonfuls of ghee and offers it with , 'O Agni, him whom thou hast chosen in the battles, him who is to be thy charioteer for ever, hail!'🔽He offers with an (oblation) to Agni, for the Agnishtoma is Agni: he thus establishes the Agnishtoma in Agni. With a verse containing (the word) 'mortal,'

translated: Now if it be an Ukthya,

translated: and should go forward (to the Sadas). He thus turns the forms of the sacrifice in the right way.

analyzed: ayuṅgāḥ ayuṅgāḥ ekadhanāḥ bhavanti
translated: They are single-wealth (Ekadhâna), not in pairs.

original: trayo vā pañca vā pañca vā sapta vā nava vā nava🔽vaikādaśa vaikādaśa vā trayodaśa vā trayodaśa vā pañcadaśa vā dvandvamaha
analyzed: trayaḥ vā pañca vā pañca vā sapta vā nava vā nava  vā ekādaśa vā ekādaśa vā trayodaśa vā trayodaśa vā pañcadaśa vā dvandvam aha
translated: Three, five, five, seven, nine, nine,

analyzed: mithunam prajananam atha eṣaḥ ekaḥ tiricyate sa yajamānasya
translated: eleven, eleven, thirteen, thirteen, fifteen (are the number of priests). A pair is a productive union. But this one (the Adhvaryu) is in excess. He exceeds the sacrificer's prosperity.

analyzed: śriyam abhyatiricyate sa vai eṣām sa dhanam yaḥ yajamānasya śriyam abhyatiricyate

analyzed: tat yat eṣām sa dhanam tasmāt ekadhanāḥ nāma
translated: Because he is their common wealth, therefore they are called Ekadhâna (single-wealth).

analyzed: atha adhiṣavaṇe paryupaviśanti
translated: They then sit down around the two pressing-boards.

original: athāsyāṃ hiraṇyam badhnīte dvayaṃ vā idaṃ na
analyzed: atha asyām hiraṇyam badhnīte dvayam vai idam na
translated: He then ties a piece of gold on this (earth). This is a duality.

original: tṛtīyamasti satyaṃ caivānṛtaṃ ca satyameva devā anṛtam manuṣyā agniretasaṃ vai
analyzed: tṛtīyam asti satyam ca eva anṛtam ca satyam eva devāḥ anṛtam manuṣyāḥ agni retasam vai
translated: There is a third truth, and also untruth; the truth is the gods, the untruth is men. Gold is produced from Agni's seed;

original: hiraṇyaṃ satyenāṃśūnupaspṛśāni satyena somam parāhaṇānīti tasmādvā asyāṃ
analyzed: hiraṇyam satyena aṃśūn upaspṛśāni satyena somam parāhaṇāni iti tasmāt vai asyām
translated: with truth he should touch the rays, with truth he should strike the Soma,' therefore he ties gold

analyzed: hiraṇyam badhnīte
translated: on this (earth).

analyzed: atha grāvāṇam ādatte
translated: Then he takes the pressing-stone.

original: te vā ete 'śmamayā grāvāṇo bhavanti devo vai somo divi hi
analyzed: te vai ete śma mayāḥ grāvāṇaḥ bhavanti devaḥ vai somaḥ divi hi
translated: Now these pressing-stones are made of stone. Soma is a god, for Soma is in heaven.

original: somo vṛtro vai soma āsīttasyaitacarīraṃ yadgirayo
analyzed: somaḥ vṛtraḥ vai somaḥ āsīt tasya etad carīram yat girayaḥ
translated: Soma was Vṛtra. His body is those mountains,

analyzed: yat aśmā anasta carīreṇa eva enam etat samardhayati kṛtsnam karoti tasmāt aśma mayā
translated: those stones. With his body he thus supplies him, makes him whole; therefore🔽they are made of stone.

original: bhavanti ghnanti vā enametadyadabhiṣuṇvanti tametena ghnanti tathāta udeti tathā
analyzed: bhavanti ghnanti vai enam etat yat abhiṣuṇvanti tam etena ghnanti tathā atas udeti tathā
translated: They kill him, indeed, when they press him; with that (stone) they kill him. Thus he rises again, thus

analyzed: saṃjīvati tasmāt aśma mayāḥ grāvāṇaḥ bhavanti
translated: he lives; therefore the pressing-stones are made of stone.

original: tamādatte / devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinorbāhubhyām pūṣṇo hastābhyāmādade
analyzed: tam ādatte devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām ādade
translated: He takes it with (the formula), 'On the impulse of the god Savitri, with the arms of the Asvins, with the hands of Pusan I take thee, O stone.'

original: rāvāsīti savitā vai devānām prasavitā tatsavitṛprasūta evainametadādatte
analyzed: rāvā asi iti savitā vai devānām prasavitā tat savitṛ prasūtaḥ eva enam etat ādatte
translated: Savitri is the impeller of the gods; impelled by Savitri he thus takes it.

analyzed: śvinoḥ bāhubhyām iti aśvinau adhvaryū tat tayoḥ eva bāhubhyām ādatte na svābhyām
translated: 'With the arms of the Asvins,'--the Asvins are the Adhvaryus; with their arms he takes it, not with his own.

original: pūṣṇo hastābhyāmiti pūṣā bhāgadughastattasyaiva hastābhyāmādatte na svābhyāṃ
analyzed: pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām iti pūṣā bhāgadughaḥ tat tasya eva hastābhyām ādatte na svābhyām
translated: 'With the hands of Pusan,'--Pusan is the distributor of shares; with his hands he takes it, not with his own.

original: vajro vā eṣa tasya na manuṣyo bhartā tametābhirdevatābhirādatte / / /
analyzed: vajraḥ vai eṣa tasya na manuṣyaḥ bhartā tam etābhiḥ devatābhiḥ ādatte
translated: For this (Soma) is a thunderbolt: no human being can hold it; he takes it with those deities.

original: ādade rāvāsīti /🔽yadā vā enametenābhiṣuṇvantyathāhutirbhavati yadāhutiṃ juhotyatha
analyzed: ādade rāvā asi iti  yadā vai enam etena abhiṣuṇvanti atha āhutiḥ bhavati yat āhutim juhoti atha
translated: 'Thou hast been taken with a support,' he says;🔽for when they press him with that (stone), then he becomes an oblation; and when he offers the oblation, then

original: dakṣiṇā dadātyetaddhyeṣa dvayaṃ rāsata āhutīśca dakṣiṇāśca tasmādāha rāvāsīti / / /
analyzed: dakṣiṇāḥ dadāti etat hi eṣa dvayam āhutīḥ ca dakṣiṇāḥ ca tasmāt āha
translated: he gives the sacrificial gift; for this (Soma) is both an oblation and a sacrificial gift: therefore he says, 'Thou hast been taken with a support.'

original: gabhīramimamadhvaraṃ kṛdhīti /🔽adhvaro vai yajño mahāntamimaṃ yajñaṃ
analyzed: gabhīram imam adhvaram kṛdhī iti  adhvaraḥ vai yajñaḥ mahāntam imam yajñam
translated: 'Make this sacrifice deep (gâbhirya),' he says;🔽for the sacrifice is a sacrifice: 'make this great sacrifice,' he thereby says.

original: kṛdhītyevaitadāhendrāya suṣūtamamitīndro vai yajñasya devatā tasmādāhendrāyeti🔽suṣūtamamiti susutamamityevaitadāhottamena pavinetyeṣa vā uttamaḥ
